The Montgomery Bus Boycott (1956) was a pivotal moment in our history that proved every day Americans can effect change through action. No effort in the name of freedom is ever too small. #BHM https://t.co/hEI1agmBzV

After traveling around the world, Miles Wilson-Toliver returned to CT to use his love of music to uplift his community. Miles aims to provide safe spaces for young men of color to express themselves through the arts. #BHM https://t.co/15ZyngDHlo
Let's join together to celebrate some of our nation's greatest leaders. Happy President's Day. https://t.co/UFtAj3BGU1

Today, we recognize global efforts towards social justice and the protection of all human rights. Peace and security cannot be achieved anywhere without equity and justice for all. https://t.co/lOCwy88WUQ

Throughout the pandemic, virtual health services have safely connected patients with care providers. Pleased to see federal funding coming back to our state to further support these efforts. https://t.co/QODIKZIWNL

In 1943, Ella Brown became the first Black policewoman in Connecticut. In her 26 years of service, she was a pillar of her community and a role model for fellow officers. #BHM https://t.co/Uxs31AXgK2

Government buildings must be accessible for all. Today, @SenBlumenthal joined me to introduce a resolution reaffirming federal support of inclusive infrastructure in public spaces. 
 
Every person deserves respect & equal protection under the law. https://t.co/9Bgi4fi142

https://t.co/2QoStHoqIs

Yesterday, I chaired the NODO subcommittee hearing to review the Office of Inspector General report on Oversight of Civil Rights Complaints at USDA. More must be done to address complaints and provide timely responses to racial or gender discrimination claims at the USDA. https://t.co/tvgGvhHdCN

Shirley Chisholm was a champion for women & families as she paved the way for members like myself to carry on the work of anti-hunger & women's rights. As Chairwoman of the Nutrition, Oversight, & Department Operations, I strive to continue her legacy. #BHM https://t.co/xiAYAlxHS1

I cannot send out another post, to mark another anniversary, of another school shooting. 
I just can‚Äôt. 
I know what today is- but I just cannot.
I will continue to work on legislation to ensure school shooting don‚Äôt continue to happen- and then I will post about that.

TOMORROW: Join me and @houseagdems as we hear from @USDA on a recent inspector general report on oversight of civil rights complaints. I will be gaveling in at 12PM‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/dnQZYy80uM

Our country has the highest maternal mortality rate among developed nations, disproportionately impacting Black women. I cosponsored the Advancing Maternal Health Equity Under Medicaid Act to reduce the gross disparities in health outcomes for mothers & save lives.

(2/2) Thank you @RepBrianFitz & @RepBrownley for your commitment to child nutrition & bringing fresh meals to schools. This bipartisan effort will set kids up for success in the classroom while expanding opportunities for local farmers & promoting workforce development.

#PostalServiceReformAct https://t.co/jgN4CbDxqI

One thing I dislike more than continuing resolutions- is government shutdowns. 

Happy to preside today as we voted to ensure gov‚Äôt is funded, veterans have access to healthcare, older Americans receive their Social Security checks, & federal workers are paid without disruption. https://t.co/ngKNUVv8yw

(1/2) Joined an @EdLaborCmte  briefing on the Juvenile Justice System and the Juvenile Justice Delinquency Prevention Act (JJDPA). Heard from advocates & researchers, and explored evidence-based practices for delinquency prevention. https://t.co/bdPxAXAnC5

Did you know Ebenezer Bassett was the first Black student at @CCSU? He later became an educator, activist, & the first Black United States Minister Resident to Haiti. In 2019, CCSU honored Mr. Bassett by renaming the Social Sciences Hall to Ebenezer D. Bassett Hall. #BHM https://t.co/tpKTLBaE5T

The need for mental health & support staff in schools is essential. Supporting and promoting a safe learning environment where kids feel seen, encouraged, & ready to learn is critical.
#NationalSchoolCounselingWeek https://t.co/qpNPZgeHBU

Fine print hidden in a lengthy contract should not stop a sexual abuse survivor from justice. Today, I voted to #EndForcedArbitration to make sure the voices of survivors are heard. https://t.co/PGRj4udrgY

Tonight the House honored the 900,000 American lives lost to the COVID-19 pandemic - including the 10,000 lives from Connecticut. My prayers are with those lost, the families, and loved ones. https://t.co/BIdIkw84Kq
Congratulations to Julia Marino of Westport, CT on winning @TeamUSA‚Äôs first medal of the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympicsüá∫üá∏ https://t.co/cgbQAzLf2Y

National Black HIV/AIDS Awareness Day addresses the impact of HIV on Black communities. I joined colleagues in urging the @CDCgov to expand equitable access of Apertude, a breakthrough form of PrEP. #StopHIVTogether #NBHAAD https://t.co/M2HBA2znk1
The Spirit of Waterbury Winter is the Pits event - didn‚Äôt skate but everyone knows I‚Äôm a sucker for good music. So much fun, almost forgot it was 18 degrees. https://t.co/CBE8rfkycj

In January, I joined my colleagues in writing to the Biden Administration to have Medicare cover COVID-19 rapid tests. Pleased to see Medicare beneficiaries will be able to receive 8 FREE over-the-counter tests per month starting this spring. https://t.co/srp9RmM7pH

Rain or shine, mail carriers show up for our communities. From delivering prescriptions, essential pandemic supplies, and constituent letters, they continue to hold our nation together. üíå RT to thank our @USPS mail carriers. https://t.co/2tXRHAM3Cs

Heart disease is the leading cause of death for women in the U.S. Do not ignore the symptoms - even if you think your risk is low. Do your part, care for your heart. 
#WearRedDay #HeartMonth https://t.co/cdklXgBYUq
Today we celebrate civil rights leader, Rosa Parks. May her bravery, determination, and commitment to freedom inspire us every day. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/XOngShpLaI

(2/2) Nothing in the oversight letter mentions anything about capping nurse pay or attempts to stop nurses from working at travel agencies. 

Really grateful to have such a timely conversation with those most impacted by my congressional action.

Joining @bshactman on @WTIC1080 to talk about the student debt crisis and my work to bring much-needed relief to student borrowers in Connecticut. https://t.co/hAZtRPRprc

Tax season is here. Keep this @IRSnews checklist in mind when filing:
‚úÖ Avoid delays by using E-file & direct deposit
‚úÖ Collect all docs & make sure info is accurate
‚úÖ Use free tools like the online IRS Free File option
‚úÖ Sign up for 1-1 tax prep through VITA or TCE programs

@capitolwatch Makes me think of an activity I often used with Ss called ‚Äútalk to the text.‚Äù This was looking at a document, asking probing questions & compelling inquiry. Seeing this picture unleashes a flood of questions. We must learn from history so we never forget. 
Thank you for sharing.

Greenhouses are the largest industry in CT-05. Today, @RepJoeCourtney joined me on a visit to Michael's Greenhouses in Cheshire. Their use of technology & robotics to sustainably raise plants is valuable input as my oversight committee looks forward to the next Farm Bill. https://t.co/AZC2Kwh0Sc

‚ÄúI have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character.‚Äù ~Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

I share every detail because the joy on his face, created by this moment, epitomizes the nation Dr. King dreamed of. Every day I work to create opportunities and make investments in the lives of young people so that moments like this are the rule and not the exception.

On this #MLK day I‚Äôm sharing one of my absolute favorite pictures. This pic of my little guy was snapped in the East Room of the White House as he congratulated me minutes after I was named National Teacher of the Year by @BarackObama https://t.co/DJxxPnvr1J

May today be a day of reflection for all of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s lessons of love, peace, justice, and the pursuit for a brighter future.

‚ÄúOur lives begin to end the day we become silent about the things that matter‚Äù~ Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. https://t.co/dQxi1W3o48
